title: Tiger Woods, Rory McIlroy and Jason Day enjoy hilarious Japanese lesson
text:
Tiger Woods may be fluent in holing putts and winning majors, but it seems his language skills leave a little to be desired.

The former world No 1 is getting ready to play in The Challenge: Japan Skins, a unique four-man event in Tokyo also featuring Rory McIlroy, Jason Day and Hideki Matsuyama.

And ahead of the big money showdown, Woods and his fellow pros took part in Japanese lesson with a difference.

Hideki Matsuyama delivers a Japanese lesson to Tiger Woods, Rory McIlroy and Jason Day

Woods and Co learn key golfing terms in the hilarious clip ahead of their visit to Japan

McIlroy, who is part of The Challenge: Japan Skins, brushes up on his Japanese in the video

Led by ‘teacher’ Matsuyama, who is widely regarded as Japan’s No 1 golfer, Woods, McIlroy and Day brushed up on some of the key golfing terms they might need at the Accordia Golf Narashino Country Club on October 21.

After starting off by learning how to pronounce two of the phrases they’ll hope to use this later month - albatross and hole-in-one - the hilarious clip descends into farce as Woods and McIlroy refuse to say ‘three putt’ as they ‘don’t need to know that one’.

Day then gets involved, cheekily asking rival Matsuyama how to say ‘I just outdrove you by 20 yards’ in Japanese. However, the five-time PGA Tour winner quickly gets his revenge, instead making the Australian repeat ‘you’re not going to need to know that’ in his native language.

Day mucks around with a putter in the classroom, using it to knock McIlroy's cap off his head

The players take it in turns to rib each other, with Matsuyama mocking Woods' famous 'glutes'

Things escalate from there as Matsuyama explains how respect for the elders is important in Japanese culture - before promptly mocking veteran Woods and his famous ‘glutes’.

And while discussing respect, Matsuyama takes aim at McIlroy and Day, showing clips of the Northern Irishman launching a club into a lake and the 2015 US PGA champion celebrating wildly after making a putt.

Woods does manage to get a measure of revenge on his teacher, joking that ‘the video paused’ while watching a snippet of Matsuyama’s trademark swing.

But Tiger saves his best gag until last, cleverly using his newfound linguistic skills to make McIlroy, who hasn’t been paying much attention, to admit he’s going to lose their four-way battle in Japan.

All four players will take part in The Challenge: Japan Skins in Tokyo later this month

Tiger Woods, Rory McIlroy, Jason Day and Hideki Matsuyama will go head-to-head in The Challenge: Japan Skins in a unique event to be streamed in full exclusively and free on GOLFTV* internationally.

*Due to existing rights agreements in the UK and Ireland, fans will be required to subscribe to watch The Challenge. Passes start at £4.99/month. In the US, The Challenge: Japan Skins can be viewed live on Golf Channel.
description: Tiger Woods may be fluent in holing putts and winning majors, but it seems his language skills leave a little to be desired. Led by 'teacher' Matsuyama, he brushed up on some of the key golfing terms.
